# {.tabset}

## COVID 19 Analysis

```{r, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}

#these libraries need to be loaded
library(utils)

#read the Dataset sheet into “R”. The dataset will be called "data".
import <- read.csv("https://opendata.ecdc.europa.eu/covid19/casedistribution/csv", na.strings = "", fileEncoding = "UTF-8-BOM") 

import$dateRep <- 
  as.Date(import$dateRep, "%d/%m/%Y")

clean_import <- import %>% 
  select(date = "dateRep",
         day:year,
         new_cases = "cases",
         new_deaths = "deaths",
         country = "countriesAndTerritories",
         geoid = "geoId",
         code = "countryterritoryCode",
         pop_2018 = "popData2018")

other_data <- read_excel("raw-data/OtherData.xlsx")

merged_data <- clean_import %>% 
  left_join(other_data) %>% 
  select(date:pop_2018,
         gdp_2018 = "GDP (constant 2010 US$) 2018",
         health_exp_gdp_2016 = "Current health expenditure (% of GDP) 2016",
         out_pocket_exp_2016 = "Out-of-pocket expenditure (% of current health expenditure) 2016",
         private_exp_pp_2016 = "Domestic private health expenditure per capita (current US$) 2016",
         gini_2017 = "GINI index (World Bank estimate) 2017") %>% 
  mutate(latin_america = ifelse(
            country == "Brazil" |
            country == "Mexico" |
            country == "Colombia" |
            country == "Argentina" |
            country == "Venezuela" |
            country == "Peru" |
            country == "Chile" | 
            country == "Ecuador" |
            country == "Guatemala" |
            country == "Cuba" |
            country == "Bolivia" |
            country == "Dominican_Republic" |
            country == "Haiti" |
            country == "Honduras" |
            country == "Paraguay" |
            country == "El_Salvador" |
            country == "Nicaragua" |
            country == "Costa_Rica" |
            country == "Puerto_Rico" |
            country == "Panama" |
            country == "Uruguay", 1, 0),
         south_america = ifelse(
            country == "Brazil" |
            country == "Colombia" |
            country == "Argentina" |
            country == "Venezuela" |
            country == "Peru" |
            country == "Chile" | 
            country == "Ecuador" |
            country == "Bolivia" |
            country == "Paraguay" |
            country == "Uruguay", 1, 0)) %>% 
  group_by(country) %>% 
  arrange(date) %>% 
  mutate(running_sum = cumsum(new_cases)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(cases_pop = (new_cases / pop_2018),
         deaths_pop = (new_deaths / pop_2018),
         deaths_cases = deaths_pop / cases_pop,
         running_sum_pop = running_sum / pop_2018) %>% 
  arrange(country)

```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
a <- merged_data %>% 
  filter(month != 1 &
           month != 2,
         south_america == 1)
```


```{r, echo = FALSE}
# Daily new cases 

ggplot(a, aes(x = date, y = new_cases, color = country)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_classic() +
  labs(
    title = "New Daily Cases by Country",
    subtitle = "Cases Rapidly Increasing After Mid-March",
       y = "New Daily Cases",
       x = "",
    caption = "Data from the European Union's European 
    Centre for Disease Prevention and Control",
    color = "Country") +
  theme(legend.position="bottom") 
#   + scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "C")
  
```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
# Cumulative cases 

ggplot(a, aes(x = date, y = running_sum, color = country)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_classic() +
  labs(
    title = "Cumulative Cases by Country",
    subtitle = "Cases Rapidly Increasing After Mid-March",
       y = "Total Cases",
       x = "",
    caption = "Data from the European Union's European 
    Centre for Disease Prevention and Control",
    color = "Country") +
  theme(legend.position="bottom") 
#   + scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "C")
  
```

## Combined Data Analysis

```{r, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
b <- merged_data %>% 
  filter(month == 3,
         day == 27,
         south_america == 1) 

ggplot(b, aes(x = gdp_2018, y = running_sum, color = country)) +
  geom_point(size = 2.5) +
  theme_classic() +
  labs(
    title = "Cumulative Cases by GDP in South America",
    subtitle = "Slight positive relationship",
       y = "Cumulative Cases on 3/27",
       x = "GDP in 2018",
    caption = "Data from the European Union's 
    European Centre for Disease Prevention 
    and Control and the World Bank",
    color = "Country") +
  theme(legend.position="bottom") 
```

```{r, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE}


ggplot(b, aes(x = gdp_2018, y = running_sum)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method='lm', formula= y~x) +
  theme_classic() +
  labs(
    title = "Cumulative Cases by GDP in South America",
    subtitle = "Slight positive relationship",
       y = "Cumulative Cases on 3/27",
       x = "GDP in 2018",
    caption = "Data from the European Union's 
    European Centre for Disease Prevention 
    and Control and the World Bank",
    color = "Country") +
  theme(legend.position="bottom") 
```
